text:
If a package name includes an international character (legal in Java) such as 
éàè, the generated Java source for the JSP is incorrect.

Example:
JSP: <%@ page import="com.agro.données.*%>
Generated servlet: import com.agro.donnï¿½es.*;

Probably a UNICODE support issue.
creator: tiboweb@btcweb.com

text: Does it happen as well with 5.0.x ?
creator: remm@apache.org
yoavs@computer.org
text: Did you try specifying javaEncoding for the JSP compiler?

Ping to the original poster of this issue: without your responses to our 
questions, it will be difficult for us to recreate the problem and chances are 
it will not be fixed.  Thank you.
creator: yoavs@computer.org

text:
Closing due to lack of interest.  If the OP is still interested he/she can 
reopen this issue and answer our questions.  Thanks.
creator: yoavs@computer.org
